timeline.author: hustodemon

timeline.bodyText:
call ErrataFactory.publish(), but that is a noop if the errata is
already published, which is always the case here

Is this true in general (outside CLM context)? This method is also used for general errata cloning via XMLRPC (ChannelSoftwareHandler.mergeErrata).
timeline.author: hustodemon

replies.bodyText: It's not true in general, for example the Struts action PackagePushAction calls publish exclusively on unpublished erratas - and for those the behavior is definitely not no-op.
replies.author: moio

timeline.message: refactoring: make comment agree with code

Make mode queries aware of Hibernate's flush mode

When handling many objects in the Hibernate cache, it is sometimes
appropriate to use the HibernateFactory#doWithoutAutoFlushing helpers
in order to prevent needless flushing which hurts performance.

Mode queries always flushed, thereby making it more difficult to mix
Hibernate-based and mode-query-based code in presence of many objects in
Hibernate's cache.

This change will prevent flushing in mode queries when
doWithoutAutoFlushing is used.

CLM speedup: use cloneErrataFaster and avoid flushing

PublishErrataHelper.cloneErrataFaster is indeed faster than
PublishErrataHelper.cloneErrataFast, but only under the assumption not
very many objects are present in Hibernate's cache, because being
implemented in mode queries it means it flush()es the Hibernate session
frequently.

This chance uses the faster method, while also preventing flushes - on a
typical CLM scenario (SLES 12 SP3-based) it makes the build time ~3x
faster.
refactoring: change parameter type to reflect implementation is mode-queries only
refactoring: insertCacheForChannelErrata: accept any Collection
refactoring: method rename to reflect code
refactoring: lookupByIdAndUser never returns null
refactoring: move adding errata to channel inside of insertCacheForChannelErrata
refactoring: change parameter type to reflect implementation is mode-queries only
refactoring: rename to reflect what code actually does
refactoring: move method to ErrataManager
refactoring: move notification setting inside of insertCacheForChannelErrata

refactoring: inline publish() and delete dead code

ErrataManager.publish() used to:

 - call ErrataFactory.publish(), but that is a noop if the errata is
already published, which is always the case here
 - call addChannelsToErrata(), which used to:
   - make sure the user had access to the specified channel. Moved to
top lookup instead, so that it is not done for each errata
   - call ErrataCacheManager.insertCacheForChannelErrata(), retained
   - call storeErrata(), which saved the Hibernate entity, but it is not
changed by current code (so also a noop)
   - call updateSearchIndex(), retained
CLM speedup: reindex search on errata once per channel, not once per errata
refactoring: remove dead code
refactoring: rename method to new semantics
CLM speedup: disable autoflushing on more code
CLM speedup: force ANALYZE of rhnChannelPackage after massive insertions
bugfix: unit test used incorrect user
